xml.definition: a W3C-standardised markup system that defines a set of rules for encoding digital documents

political science.definition: the branch of knowledge that deals with the state and systems of government

gender studies.definition: an interdisciplinary field and academic studies devoted to gender identity and gendered representation as central categories of analysis, including women's studies (concerning women, feminism, gender, and politics), men's studies and LGBT studies.

theatre studies.definition: the study of theatrical performance in relation to its literary, physical, psycho-biological, sociological, and historical contexts

theology.definition: the critical study of concepts of God and of the nature of religious ideas.

psychology.definition: the scientific study of the human mind and its functions

demography.definition: the study of statistics which illustrate the changing structure of human populations

economics.definition: the branch of knowledge concerned with the production, consumption, and transfer of wealth

education.definition: the process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits

communication studies.definition: academic discipline that deals with processes of human communication

architecture.definition: both the process and the product of planning, designing, and constructing buildings and other physical structures

text encoding.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
text encoding.definition: the representation of printed texts in digital format

folia.definition: an XML-based annotation format, suitable for the representation of linguistically annotated language resources

tei.definition: a set of guidelines which specify encoding methods for machine-readable texts, chiefly in the humanities, social sciences and linguistics

art studies.definition: the academic study of the history and development of visual arts

methods and statistics.definition: the practice or science of collecting and analysing numerical data in large quantities

law.definition: systems of law as a subject of study or as the basis of the legal profession

media studies.definition: a discipline and field of study that deals with the content, history, and effects of various media; in particular, the mass media

oriental studies.definition: the academic field of study that embraces Near Eastern and Far Eastern societies and cultures, languages, peoples, history and archaeology

geography.definition: the study of the physical features of the earth and its atmosphere, and of human activity as it affects and is affected by these

philosophy.definition: the study of general and fundamental problems concerning matters such as existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language

lexicography.definition: the activity or occupation of compiling dictionaries

linguistics.definition: the scientific study of language and its structure

corpus linguistics.definition: the branch of linguistics concerned with analysis of corpora as a means of studying language

morphology.definition: the study of the forms of words

archaeology.definition: the study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and the analysis of artefacts and other physical remains

semantic web vocabularies.definition: machine-readable terminologies that define concepts and relationships used to describe and organize data on the web

skos.definition: a W3C recommendation format designed for the representation of thesauri, classification schemes, taxonomies, subject-heading systems, or any other type of structured controlled vocabulary

rdf.definition: a group of W3C specifications designed as a metadata data model to provide interoperability between applications that exchange machine-understandable information on the Web. It is used as a general method for conceptual description or modeling of information.

foaf.definition: a machine-readable ontology describing persons, their activities and their relations to other people and objects

cidoc crm.definition: a machine-readable ontology that provides definitions and a formal structure for describing general (top-level) concepts and relationships; used mainly in cultural heritage domain

cultural studies.definition: the study of contemporary (especially mass) culture

literary studies.definition: the study, evaluation, and interpretation of literature

history studies.definition: the study of past events, particularly in human affairs

audio recording.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
audio recording.definition: a digital representation of acoustic signals

video recording.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
video recording.definition: a digital representation of visual and acoustic signals

3d.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
3d.definition: a digital representation of objects in a three-dimensional space

map.definition: schematic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads, etc.

image.definition: a two-dimensional visual representation of something

language resource.definition: a language  resource  is  any  physical  or  digital  item  that  is  a  product  of  language  documentation,  description,  or  development  or  is  a  tool  that  specifically  supports  the creation and use of such products

corpus.definition: large and structured set of texts electronically stored and processed

treebank.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
treebank.definition: collections of texts (or just sentences) annotated with complete syntactic structure

historical text.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
historical text.definition: any text created in the past

lexical resource.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
lexical resource.definition: a structured list of words or multi-word expressions providing reference information about their meaning, translations in other languages, pronunciation, origin, usage etc.

historical language.definition: a language that is spoken in a historical period, but that is distinct from its modern form; that is, it is a form of language historically attested to from the past which has evolved into more modern forms

oai pmh.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
oai pmh.definition: a protocol for exposing and collecting descriptions (metadata) of archival objects (or any digital objects)

semantic resource.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
semantic resource.definition: a machine-readable data-set conveying structured information about concepts and their relations to each other used as a basic building block of the semantic web

taxonomy.definition: hierarchical classification of entities of interest

ontology.definition: formal representations of a set of concepts within a domain and the relationships between those concepts

vocabulary.definition: list of words or phrases used to classify units of information

knowledge base.definition: complex information resource that consists of structured and unstructured data to be used in digital applications

optical character recognition.definition: mechanical or electronic conversion of images of typed, handwritten or printed text into machine-encoded text

digital edition.definition: a scholarly edition is the critical representation of historical documents

repository.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
repository.definition: service for depositing/preserving (and optionally presenting) resources

sentiment analysis.definition: procedure of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text

search service.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
search service.definition: service that allows to query a specific set of information resources

metasearch.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
metasearch.definition: services that allows to query multiple search services and aggregates the multiple results to one result set

machine translation.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
machine translation.definition: system or procedure automatically expressing text from one language in another language

gis.definition: system for storing and manipulating geographical information

nlp.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
nlp.definition: tools and methods to process (analyse, enrich, transform) language resources

tokenisation.definition: process of breaking a stream of text up into words, phrases, symbols, or other meaningful elements called tokens

tagging.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
tagging.definition: the assignment of descriptive labels (from a defined vocabulary) to particular segments of text, such as (but not only) word-class identifiers to tokens

pos tagging.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
pos tagging.definition: process of classification of individual tokens in a text as belonging to a particular part of speech or word class

parsing.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
parsing.definition: process of analysing the syntactic structures of a written (natural language) text

ner.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
ner.definition: process of identifying mentions of individuals/entities in a text

entity linking.definition: task of determining the identity of entities mentioned in text that requires a knowldge base containing the netities to which entity mentions can be linked

lemmatisation.definition: process of grouping together the different inflected forms of a word to its canonical form so that they can be analysed as a single item

social network analysis.definition: a set of methods used to investigate relationships and  interactions of individual actors and/or groups

oais.definition: a system and a reference model for organisation of archival preservation and access to the digital information over the time

vre.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
vre.definition: application integrating access to resources and a number of specialized functions, tailored to specific research methods, allowing collaborative work

visualization.definition: visual representation of data/information aimed at better ways of exploring the data

graph.definition: (mathematical) structure representing objects (nodes) and relations between them (edges)

annotation.definition: metadata (e.g. a comment, explanation, presentational markup) attached to text, image, or other data, both manual and automatic

editor.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
editor.definition: tool for viewing and modifying digital objects

xml editor.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
xml editor.definition: digital tool with special functionalities for viewing and authoring data in XML

crowdsourcing.definition: practice of solving a given (data processing) task by contributions from a large group of people via the Internet

terminology.definition: the body of terms used with a particular technical application in a subject of study, profession, etc.

semantic interoperability.definition: ability of information systems to exchange data with unambiguous, shared meaning

schema mapping.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
schema mapping.definition: process of establishing pairwise semantic equivalencies (or other semantic relations) between distinct knowledge representations

copyright and licensing.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
copyright and licensing.definition: information about rights and conditions of use and distribution of resources

e learning.definition: learning conducted via electronic media, typically on the Internet

semantic web.definition: extension of the web, a common framework that allows data to be shared and reused across application, enterprise, and community boundaries

linked data.definition: method of publishing structured data so that it can be interlinked and become more useful through semantic queries

metadata.definition: data about data, structured information that describes an information resource

cmdi.definition: a framework to describe and reuse metadata schemas, based on the idea of reusable components and concept-based semantic interoperability

open access.definition: resources (both research outputs and research data) that are free of all restrictions on access and free of many restrictions on use

open source.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
open source.definition: software free for use, distribution and improvements

programming.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
programming.definition: information about programming guides, tutorials, documentation

glam.definition: publicly funded, publicly accountable institutions collecting and presenting cultural heritage materials

cultural heritage.definition: legacy of physical artifacts and intangible attributes of a group or society that are inherited from past generations, maintained in the present and bestowed for the benefit of future generations

research infrastructure.definition: facilities, resources and related services used by the scientific community to conduct research

parthenos.definition: European cluster infrastucture H2020 project that aims to pool and harmonize the activities in existing research infrastructures  and strengthen the cohesion of research in the broad sector of Linguistic Studies, Humanities, Cultural Heritage, History, Archaeology and related fields

clarin.definition: European research infrastructure for the Humanities and Social Sciences, focusing on language resources (data and tools)

ariadne.definition: research infrastructure that brings together and integrates existing archaeological research data infrastructures

dariah.definition: pan-european infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods

europeana.definition: multi-lingual online collection of millions of digitised items from European museums, libraries, archives and multi-media collections

data management.definition: data management comprises all the disciplines related to managing data as a valuable resource

research data management.definition: research data management concerns the organisation of data, from its entry to the research cycle through to the dissemination and archiving of valuable results

digitisation.definition: the process of converting information into a digital (i.e. computer-readable) format, in which the information is organized into bits

biographical data.definition: a detailed description of a person's life that involves more than just the basic facts like education, work, relationships, and death; it portrays a person's experience of these life events

query language.definition: formalised system of signs for retrieving information from structured data stores (databases)

sql.definition: query language for manipulating and retrieving data stored in relational databases

sparql.definition: query language for manipulating and retrieving data stored in RDF format

cqp/cql.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
cqp/cql.definition: query language used to search corpus

sru/cql.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
sru/cql.definition: protocol for querying structured data stores, using Context Query Language as query language and XML-based return format; mainly used in library systems

digital preservation.definition: a formal endeavor to ensure that digital information of continuing value remains accessible and usable

type reading.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
type reading.definition: books, articles, journals, technical reports, documentation etc. informing on DH topics

type organisation.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
type organisation.definition: groups of people such as organisations, research infrastructures, institutions, consortia, networks, etc.

type resource.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
type resource.definition: online resources (both static and dynamic or interactive) that can be explored or downloaded and used for further research; e.g. datasets, digital editions, web applications, catalogues, registries, processing services, etc.

type software.creator: ACDH-OEAW Team
type software.definition: processing instructions that can be executed on a computer (scripts, command-line tools, programs)

musicology.definition: the scholarly analysis of, and research on, music, a part of humanities.

social sciences.definition: the scientific study of human society and social relationships
